content: The following lists events that happened during **1965 in Singapore**. - [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) was a part of the Federation of [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia) until 9 August 1965. ## Incumbents - [President](/wiki/President_of_Singapore): [Yusof Ishak](/wiki/Yusof_Ishak) (starting 9 August) - [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore): [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) (starting 9 August) ## Events ### January - 6 January – The Orchard Theatre (present-day [Cathay Cineleisure Orchard](/wiki/Cathay_Cineleisure_Orchard)) was opened. ### March - 10 March – [Indonesian](/wiki/Indonesia) [saboteurs](/wiki/Saboteurs) carry out the [MacDonald House bombing](/wiki/MacDonald_House_bombing), killing 3 people. ### May - 9 May – [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) begins campaigning for a [Malaysian Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysian_Malaysia). It began with the formation of the [Malaysian Solidarity Convention](/wiki/Malaysian_Solidarity_Convention). ### July - 10 July – A [by-election](/wiki/1965_Hong_Lim_by-election) was held in Hong Lim after [Ong Eng Guan](/wiki/Ong_Eng_Guan) of the [United People's Party](/wiki/United_People%27s_Party_(Singapore)) resigned. After the vote, [Lee Khoon Choy](/wiki/Lee_Khoon_Choy) from the [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) was elected into Hong Lim constituency, defeating Ong Chang Sam of the [Barisan Sosialis](/wiki/Barisan_Sosialis). ### August - 7 August- The Independence of Singapore Agreement was signed by both Malaysia and Singapore - 9 August – - The Malaysian Parliament votes to expel Singapore from the Federation; Singapore becomes independent after separating from Malaysia. - On the same day, the [Ministry of Foreign Affairs](/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs_(Singapore)) was established, as well as the [Ministry of Interior and Defence](/wiki/Ministry_of_Interior_and_Defence). - TV Singapura merges with Radio Singapura to form Radio and Television Singapore (RTS). ### September - 21 September – Singapore is admitted into the United Nations as the 117th member. ### October - 15 October – - Singapore becomes the 22nd member of the [Commonwealth](/wiki/Commonwealth_of_Nations). - The [Singapore Conference Hall](/wiki/Singapore_Conference_Hall) is officially opened. ### November - 27 November – Singapore's first underground carpark is officially opened in [Raffles Place](/wiki/Raffles_Place), with a public garden built on top. ### December - 8 December – The first sitting of [Parliament](/wiki/1st_Parliament_of_Singapore) commenced. However, [MPs](/wiki/Member_of_parliament) from [Barisan Sosialis](/wiki/Barisan_Sosialis) boycotted the first session. - 14–21 December – Singapore took part in the 3rd [South East Asian Peninsular Games](/wiki/South_East_Asian_Peninsular_Games). It clinched the third place, accumulating a total of 76 medals. - 22 December – Constitutional Amendment Act is passed and [Yusof bin Ishak](/wiki/Yusof_bin_Ishak) becomes the first [President of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore). - 23 December – The Singapore Army Act is passed, leading to the formation of the [Singapore Army](/wiki/Singapore_Army). - 30 December – The People's Defence Force Act was passed, leading to the formation of the People's Defence Force. This was done to build up the Singapore Army before the introduction of [National Service](/wiki/National_service_in_Singapore). ## Births - 12 January – [Rayson Tan](/wiki/Rayson_Tan), actor. - 5 February – [Paul Tambyah](/wiki/Paul_Tambyah), 7th Chairman of the [Singapore Democratic Party](/wiki/Singapore_Democratic_Party). - 24 March - [Gurmit Singh](/wiki/Gurmit_Singh), actor. - [Yee Jenn Jong](/wiki/Yee_Jenn_Jong), former [Workers' Party](/wiki/Workers%27_Party_(Singapore)) [NCMP](/wiki/NCMPs). - 27 March – [Eric Khoo](/wiki/Eric_Khoo), filmmaker. - 28 March – [Sylvia Lim](/wiki/Sylvia_Lim), lawyer and 10th [Chairwoman of Workers' Party](/wiki/Workers%27_Party_(Singapore)#Leadership). - 19 July – [Maliki Osman](/wiki/Maliki_Osman), assistant professor and former politician. - 22 August – [Chen Liping](/wiki/Chen_Liping), actress. - 10 October – [Chen Xiuhuan](/wiki/Chen_Xiuhuan), actress. - 22 October – [Ang Hin Kee](/wiki/Ang_Hin_Kee), former [PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) MP for [Ang Mo Kio GRC](/wiki/Ang_Mo_Kio_Group_Representation_Constituency). - 13 November – [Yang Libing](/wiki/Yang_Libing), actress. - 30 November – [Zainal Sapari](/wiki/Zainal_Sapari), former [PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) MP for [Pasir Ris–Punggol GRC](/wiki/Pasir_Ris%E2%80%93Punggol_Group_Representation_Constituency). ### Dates unknown - [Boey Kim Cheng](/wiki/Boey_Kim_Cheng), poet. - [Elim Chew](/wiki/Elim_Chew), founder of 77th Street. - [Felix Cheong](/wiki/Felix_Cheong), poet. - [Lily Kong](/wiki/Lily_Kong), academic. - [Haresh Sharma](/wiki/Haresh_Sharma), resident playwright of [The Necessary Stage](/wiki/The_Necessary_Stage). - Joash Moo, novelist, poet and illustrator. ## Deaths - 16 February – Lee Chin Tian, Chinese community leader and businessman (b. 1874). - 15 May – [Edgeworth David](/wiki/Edgeworth_David_(colonial_administrator)), last [Chief Secretary of Singapore](/wiki/Chief_Secretary_(Singapore)) (b. 1908). - 11 October – George Lee Geok Eng, businessman and newspaper publisher (b. 1897). This Singapore-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: 1965 in Singapore
